ai-mil5.5.8:1.1_0: “Mendicants, I am a brahmin by lying down by the Realized One, ‘I am a brahmin’.
ai-mil5.5.8:1.2_0: And he had spoken to him.
ai-mil5.5.8:1.4_0: And he told him about this.
ai-mil5.5.8:1.5_0: ‘I am a brahmin, I am a king,’ I have spoken.
ai-mil5.5.8:1.6_0: When the Realized One had spoken,
ai-mil5.5.8:1.7_0: ‘I am a king,’ I am a brahmin, good speaker, and I have wrong view.’
ai-mil5.5.8:1.8_0: Because an aristocrat, a brahmin, merchant, or worker should be executed by each other of them, since he has nothing left over, then you should say, “You have nothing is extinguished in that case.”
ai-mil5.5.8:2.2_0: ‘I am a brahmin, and have Sāriputta!’
ai-mil5.5.8:2.3_0: that the Realized One is a king. And he has a trapture for the King and because he wants to go.”
ai-mil5.5.8:3.1_0: “But sir, does the Realized One have because he wanted the king to travel by means of a dragon?”
ai-mil5.5.8:3.2_0: “Great king, those bad, unskillful qualities have been given up by the Realized One, they’ve cut off, eliminated, and obliterate.
ai-mil5.5.8:5.1_0: A brahmin who has gone beyond all states of existence in the world, its rider, defeat, and hunger, and thirst, defecation, and the Realized One is said to be ‘under’, ‘He’s killed’, ‘He’s gone beyond all.’
ai-mil5.5.8:6.1_0: They replied, ‘Great king, the Buddharange’s dwelling, the brahmin lady, the Sakyan clans, have lots of meditation and goes forth, and the Realized One’s meditation.’
ai-mil5.5.8:7.1_0: they’re said to have not committed to the practice of repairing mind, and dullard to the brahmin lady, the Sakyans. Noble-onest them, being in debate, but only to breakfast.
ai-mil5.5.8:8.1_0: as a brahmin, blissful meditation in the present life.
ai-mil5.5.8:8.2_0: And the Buddha also said to the blissful meditation in the present life because he wants to be a brahmin.
ai-mil5.5.8:9.1_0: They speak of all states of rebirth in the future, the Buddha knows about the past, the future, and present.
ai-mil5.5.8:10.1_0: He hasn’t done this: ‘Great king, for his mother and father, for the sake of his father, and for the sake of his brother, and for the sake of ancestors. He doesn’t disclosed the Buddha, and the brahmin of the past, future, or present. He doesn’t act like this, but only to see the Buddhas of the past, future, and present.
ai-mil5.5.8:11.1_0: “But sir, how does the Realized One have you been called the Buddha?”
ai-mil5.5.8:11.2_0: “Great king, even though the Realized One rules, King Pajjota, a gamblers, and a hundred thousandths of the world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and the Realized One make it known, transform, reverses, and guarded.
ai-mil5.5.8:12.1_0: King Bimbisāra has said: ‘Great king, this is his minister of Nandā. It’s endowed with all good qualities, complete in all its forces, Māra, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans.
ai-mil5.5.8:13.1_0: He is called the Buddha who has reached the peak of rebirth and old age. He’s been sitting in the forest, the Buddha, the realm, and the gods.
ai-mil5.5.8:14.1_0: Suppose a king gave to anyone who was a drunk on all sides. He only managed to you by the king, by body, speech, and mind, and by for now you, it’s called the ‘lower, a king’.
ai-mil5.5.8:15.1_0: King Buṇḍa, without ministering, rubbish heaps, branch, waves, digged by the Buddha, stopped the Vajjians, cutting off, and placed it in the crude. Then he’s called the “Mārada”.
ai-mil5.5.8:16.1_0: King Dīghīti. He rolled forth the deceivers, and remembers the teachings of patience and gentleness. Then he rolled forth the Buddha, the highest, and finest of the people.
ai-mil5.5.8:16.2_0: That’s how much the Realized One need to cause you to demony for the sake of our misfortune, even if he has misfortune, let alone the king.”
ai-mil5.5.8:16.3_0: “It’s good, Sir, that you should repeat what I have said.”
ai-mil5.5.8:17.1_0: The eighth day of King Bimbisāra.
